home.p1_1: The Kast-Bus website provides an information gateway for urban transportation inside
home.p2: The platform includes the schedule of bus routes that serve the university faculties, as well as routes connecting the city of Kastoria with nearby areas.
home.p3: Additionally, you will find information about bus departure/arrival times, along with updates on any changes or delays.
home.p4: Kast-Bus is designed to offer a simple and fast experience for students, professors, and university staff, giving them the ability to easily plan their transportation.

t0.title: Founding
t0.description: The Urban KTEL of Kastoria was founded and has been operating since 26/11/1964, while before that, the transportation of residents was carried out by boats that ran routes across Lake Kastoria.

t1.title: Unification of KTEL
t1.description: In 1967, the two KTEL services of Kastoria — the intercity and the urban — were unified. Subsequently, the licenses of the three boats that handled transportation on the lake were revoked, and in their place, three new licenses for urban buses were issued.

t2.title: Expansion and Modernization
t2.description: From 1980 onward, many efforts were made to expand, reorganize, and modernize the KTEL.

t3.title: Fleet Renewal
t3.description: Renewal of the entire fleet with modern buses equipped with ticket-issuing machines.

t4.title: Creation of a New Terminal
t4.description: Creation of a new terminal with modern facilities, equipped with ticket-issuing machines and a passenger waiting area.
